fields.description:
h5. scenario:
After adding a new chart to an Excel worksheet (which already have an existing chart), viewxls macro unable to render the Excel file and the following error appear in the page:
{code}
Error rendering macro 'viewxls' : com.benryan.conversion.ConversionException: java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

The following error appear in atlassian-confluence.logs:
{code}
2014-01-28 22:34:58,897 ERROR [http-8080-4] [xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller] marshal Exception executing macro: viewxls, with message: com.benryan.conversion.ConversionException: java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

With a single chart in the worksheet, the viewxls macro is rendered just fine.

Working sample:
# Attach [^report-before.xlsx]
# Result: viewxls macro can render the Excel file just fine and the single chart is displayed

Non-working sample:
# Attach [^report-after.xlsx]
# Result: You'll get this error in Confluence page:
{code}
Error rendering macro 'viewxls' : com.benryan.conversion.ConversionException: java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

The difference was that there is a new chart added to the same worksheet where there is already an existing chart.

h5. Things that we have tested (based on the sample Excel files):
# To successfully display the second chart - the chart needs to be created on the same 'JUNIT in Build' worksheet where the data resides.
# Strangely, when editing the Excel file using Open Office but not using MS Excel and moved the 'JUNIT in Build' data into 'Charts' worksheet, both charts can be displayed fine:
!https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/745648/745648_xls.jpg!
fields.summary: Viewxls macro is unable to display two charts in the same worksheet
Allow assignee to be selected when creating a JIRA issue via Confluence

fields.description:
Hello.
Every time when Confluence Internal Directory synchronise with MS Active Directory we have this problems:
1. Any page loads for 3-4 minutes
2. Heap memory 1% free
3. Cpu loads for 70-80%
Finally, we have got "Synchronisation failed". And job scheduler doesn't works.
Logs:
Jan 31, 2014 2:54:12 PM com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl _initiate
INFO: Initiating Jersey application, version 'Jersey: 1.8-atlassian-11 03/22/2013 05:02 PM'
Exception in thread "scheduler_QuartzSchedulerThread" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
Exception in thread "http-80-40" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue.checkNotNull(Unknown Source)
        at java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue.offer(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler$1.offer(Http11Protocol.java:551)
        at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler$1.offer(Http11Protocol.java:568)
        at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.process(Http11Protocol.java:632)
        at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.JIoEndpoint$Worker.run(JIoEndpoint.java:489)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

I tried to increase memory size on java start from 
"-Xms256m -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m" to "-Xms512m -Xmx768m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m"
Even that doesn't helps.
fields.summary: AD synchronisation. OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space

h5. Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a page with some headings and the TOC macro on top:
!1_CreatePage.png|thumbnail!
2) Page view with TOC macro:
!2_PageWithToc.png|thumbnail!
3) Create JIRA issue by highlighting a heading:
!3_CreateIssue.png|thumbnail!
4) Problem occurs:
!4_Problem.png|thumbnail!
5) Remove TOC from page:
!5_DeleteToc.png|thumbnail!
6) Page view without TOC macro:
!6_PageWithoutToc.png|thumbnail!
7) Create JIRA issue by highlighting another heading (not the one from step 3):
!7_CreateIssue.png|thumbnail!
8) Creating and adding issue is successful. JIRA Issue macro is added to heading:
!8_CreateIssueSuccessful.png|thumbnail!
9) JIRA Issue macro is inserted besides the heading:
!9_JIRAmacro.png|thumbnail!
10) Insert TOC again. TOC is displayed without a problem:
!10_PageWithToc.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
When replacing a macro on a page which partially is similar to the macro that replaces it, an error is shown in the logs when performing a page compare.

How to Reproduce:
# Create a page
# Place the "recently updated" macro on the page and save
# Edit the page, remove the "recently updated" and replace it with the "recently used labels"

The log will show the following error:
{code}2014-02-03 09:19:58,211 WARN [http-8090-1] [atlassian.confluence.diff.MacroIconInsertingPostProcessor] processMacroHeaderElements Could not find macro with name 'recently-'
{code}
fields.summary: Page compare throws an error when a macro gets replaced with a partially similar macro

Steps to reproduce:
1. Відкрити додаток helloworld.exe
2. Відкрити консоль ("cmd" або "виполонить"), 
3. В командний рядок  консолі введіть "telnet 127.0.0.1" і  виберіть будь-який порт  окрім  (4010) натисніть enter
Actual result:
Сервер не  підключився до вибраного порту.
Expected result:
Сервер має підключитись до вибраного порту.

  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Відкрити додаток helloworld.exe
2. Відкрити консоль ("cmd" або "виполонить"), 5 разів
3. В командний рядок кожної консолі введіть "telnet 127.0.0.1 4010" і натисніть  enter

Actual result:
Сервер не витримує більше двох підключень.

Expected result:
Сервер має виконувати до п'яти підключень.

Drag and drop move page feature between spaces.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32448].
  {panel}

Currently, when user try to move pages to another space and if another page exist in the space with an indentical title, the following error will appear.
!sample.png!

This error does not tell the user what the title name nor the location of the duplicate page. Imagine if the user is trying to a parent pages with hundred of child pages and encounter the error above, it would take tremendous amount of effort just to find the duplicate title between the spaces.

In my opinion, the warning should at least inform the title of the pages which are duplicated in the spaces they are trying to move into. This way, the user know which page title they need to change.
fields.summary: A better duplicate page warning when try to move pages between spaces.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32440].
  {panel}

When creating a link to a page within Confluence, there should be a way to use a page property's value from that page as the link text. When the page property's value on that other page changes, the incoming link texts should be changed as well.

Real-Life Example: 

We are using Confluence as a requirements specification tool. Every page represents a requirement. Since the navigation tree becomes a little bit unreadable when the title is too long, we are using a short description of the requirement as the title (e.g. "Send Password Reset Token"). On the page, we are using the "Page Properties Macro" to add some other details to the requirement. One of these properties is a field called "User Story" which describes the requirement in one sentence. (e.g. "As a user, I want to get a password reset token to be able to change my password")

When we are referencing this page/requirement we often have the case that we would like to use the "User Story"-value as the link text since this is more detailed.
fields.summary: Automatically changing Link Texts based on a Page Property from the target page

fields.description:
When clicking an anchor link from another page, if there is a code macro block prior to the anchor location the link page will render with the anchor farther down then it should be.  This only appears in Firefox (latest version v26).

*Steps to reproduce in Firefox*
# Create a page with many lines (say 200 lines)
# At line 100, place an anchor
# Anywhere above line fifty, enter a code block macro with multiple lines (say 10)
# Create another page with a link to the anchor
# Click the link for the anchor and notice that when we are brought to the page the anchor is pushed down by 10 lines

For a counter example, click the same link in Chrome or IE to see the difference.

*Workaround*
Wrap the code block inside in the 'expand' macro.
fields.summary: Code Macro Interferes with Anchors in Firefox

fields.description:
From Confluence version 5.2.5 to latest when you hit the diagnostic mode in the UI, all the debug logging will go to the tomcat terminal instead of the atlassian-confluence.log.

h4.Steps to reproduce:
# Go to Confluence Admin > Logging and Profiling.
# Hit the "Diagnostics" button under Log4j Logging.
# Navigate in Confluence and make any changes you like (create/delete a space/page).
# If you open the <Confluence Home>\llogs\atlassian-confluence.log, you will only see this line:
{code}
2014-01-30 19:03:38,256 DEBUG [http-8090-1] [atlassian.confluence.logging.ConfluenceHomeLogAppender] shutdown closing appender
{code}
# Now if you check the Tomcat Terminal you will see all the debug information being generated in there:
!img.PNG!

This was done in a windows environment, however we have a customers with linux that also have the same behaviour, the logging doesn't go to catalina.out either or any of the other Confluence logs.

This works fine in Confluence version 5.2.3, but it shows this behaviour from version 5.2.5 to latest.

h4.Work Around:
# Shutdown Confluence.
# Navigate to <Confluence Install>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes.
# Backup the log4j.properties file.
# Edit the file.
# Search for the first uncommented "log4j.logger".
# Under it add the classes you want like below example:
{code}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira=DEBUG
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin=DEBUG
{code}
# Save the file and start Confluence.
# The DEBUG will show up in atlassian-confluence log in the way it supposed to.
# Once you get the information you want, restore the log4j.properties file to it's previous version

fields.description:
Flaw in Atlassian built-in Navlink plugin that is responsible for populating top unified menu. 
The weak-spot can be hit with any slow (due to computationally intensive macros or smth..) page.
The root cause scenario:
# Request processor thread opens a transaction (consumes one db connection), then at some point
# asks another thread (from "Navlink executor pool") to populate some collections for the menu,
# this Navlink Executor thread opens another transaction (consumes second db connection)

If many requests occur concurrently, then all of the DB pool is consumed on step 1, and Navlink Executors hang on trying to aquire a DB connection. From this point no requests will be served at all till Confluence restart.

fields.description:
From Confluence 5.3 onwards it's not possible any more to add macro parameters when calling MacroDefinition.setParameters inside a MacroDefinitionUpdater, when the xhtml-macro definition declares any parameters.

MacroDefinitionUpdaters are used from:
{code}
    String body = xhtmlContent.updateMacroDefinitions(ceo.getBodyAsString(), conversionContext, new MacroDefinitionUpdater(){
{code}

This problem appears as soon as the macro has a parameter defined like
{code}
    <xhtml-macro name="macro-test" class="test.TestMacro" key="macroTest">
        <parameters>
            <parameter name="name" type="string" required="true"/>
....
{code}
Even if I add a placeholder in the macro definition for parameter I want updated, it is not added. Works in Confluence 4.3 - 5.2.

h3. Cause

Confluence 5.3 now tries to maintain some structured values for macro params inside a new ac:structured-macro element. The storage macro marshaller for this element treats the MacroDefinition.typedParameters property as canonical in this case, and it only consults the (untyped) parameters property if the typedParameters property is null or empty.

As of Confluence 5.8, the types of typedParameters values can be one of:
* for xhtml-macro declared parameter type "username": UserResourceIdentifier
* for "spacekey": SpaceResourceIdentifier
* for "confluence-content": Link to a ResourceIdentifier 
* for "url": UrlResourceIdentifier
* for "attachment": AttachmentResourceIdentifier
* for "full_attachment" (new in 5.6.5 and 5.7): AttachmentResourceIdentifier, fully qualified with the containing page/blog post and spacekey
* otherwise: String

Right now, too many property types are still treated as strings for the typedParameters map to be a permanent replacement. Longer term, the parameters property will be deprecated, and callers will need to migrate to using the typedParameters API.

Note also that handling for the default parameter is now also different: it is stored keyed by the empty string (""), rather than as a separate property. This applies to both the typedParameters and parameters properties.

h3. Workarounds

For all of the workarounds below, you will need to define the macro parameter correctly in your xhtml-macro definition. You cannot rely on your parameter being parsed and stored safely without this. You can mark this parameter as hidden if you do not want it to show up in the macro editor.

1. Update the MacroDefinition.typedParameters property to hold the value you want to add/update, using the types as described above. This is the safest and most forwards compatible option. OR
2. Build a fresh MacroDefinition with the MacroDefinitionBuilder containing just the properties you want stored. This option risks shearing off additional attributes the Confluence internals want to store. OR
3. Null the typedParameters, to force the persistence code to fall back to using the old parameters property instead. Note that this option may cause page, blog and attachment links to break again, due to the problems with wikimarkup special characters.

h3. Fix

We could add a way of tracking if the MacroDefinition.parameters property was modified while invoking any of the XhtmlContent macro methods, and if so use it to persist the macro params instead of the typed parameters. Note that this may cause page, blog and attachment links to break again, due to the problems with wikimarkup special characters
fields.summary: Cannot add macro parameters programmatically in Confluence version gt 5.2

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Install Confluence Clustered 3.5.17
# Set up Application link between Confluence and JIRA.
# Create some issues in JIRA and use JIRA Issue macro in Confluence to show them.
# Upgrade Confluence clustered to 5.1.5
# You'll see the following stack-trace upon seeing the page with JIRA Issue macro:
{code}
Error rendering macro 'jiraissues' : com.atlassian.confluence.macro.MacroExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Resource is not serializable: Key=partialUrl:https://test.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?tempMax=20&jqlQuery=project+%3D+oppk+ORDER+BY+created+DESC columns:[type, key, summary, assignee, reporter, priority, status, resolution, created, updated, due] showCount:false userName=ptimmer isMapped=true, Value=com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.JiraChannelResponseHandler@e5e45f2
{code}

h3. Probably root cause:
When upgrading a Confluence cluster, the cache file in the home directory is not modified at all.

h3. Workaround:
The solution then is to configure that particular cache to be local. The configuration happens in /confluence-cache-config-clustered.xml

Change the scheme-name to *local:default*
{code}
<cache-name>com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.JiraIssuesMacro</cache-name>
<scheme-name>local:default</scheme-name>
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA Issues macro fails because the confluence-coherence-cache-config-clustered.xml file is not being updated in clustered upgrades
Ability to search for JIRA issues inside Confluence
Template Update

fields.description:
In Confluence 5.4.x, if you highlight a text, there's a feature to create a JIRA issue from there as we can see in the screenshot below: 

!issues.png! 

However, if you try to create the issue highlighting specific content, *only triple clicking* (which would select the whole line) it's not working. In example: 

h4.With Bullet Lists

# Edit a page
# Insert new lines using the bullet list feature
# Triple click on the text from the list:
!triple.png!
# The following is displayed:
!jira.png!

If you manually select just the text or double click, the issue creation will work as expected. 

h4.With Checkboxes 

The same steps can be reproduce as described above, but, with checkboxes in the content of the pages:

# Edit a page containing checkboxes
# Triple click on the text
!box.png!
# The same warning message will be displayed

*Notes*: 

# With the bullet list content, it's only happening with the content inside the attached Storage Format file in this ticket, so it can be tested against any instance. If you create a new page, insert a bullet list, it will be successively created. For the checkbox, it happens even with a brand new content created.
# It's only happening in Google Chrome (tested version: 32.0.1700.102) browser
fields.summary: Triple Click with Google Chrome to Highlight Text to Create JIRA Issues Not Working with Specific Content

fields.description:
Hi,

Your styling for the "Reset Password" button in your "Account password" email does not render correctly in Lotus Notes.

The gist is that the styling for the blue background for the button is not being applied and so it only shows the white text. This is a problem as the background for the container in which the button is in is also white, which means that users are not seeing the link.

STR:
1) Request password reset email via the login page for Confluence.
2) Enter the username for a user.
3) Open email from Confluence in Lotus Notes.
fields.summary: Button in Reset Password Email Not Rendering Correctly in Lotus Notes

Initial steps:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32410].
  {panel}

From a product and development planning perspective, I like the idea of being able to write up changes and tasks in a Confluence page and then being able to automatically create tickets based on the content of this page. Which is broadly what this macros does.

However, in its current state it will only take the text you highlight in one cell and add this as the Summary to the Jira ticket. And if you select to make multiple tickets, it will then generate tickets using the content of the same cell from the rows below. So you now have several tickets of the same type with only the Summary field populated, and if you need to add Description, Component, FixVersion, Epic, etc fields, then that has to be done manually.
So my request is to have the ability to have more fields, included custom fields, added automatically from other columns in the table.

As an example, consider the following example table with 5 columns, 1 header row, and 3 content rows where "h" is the header row, and RC is a cell in a row

| h1 | h2 | h3 | h4| h5|
|R1C1 | R1C2 | R1C3 | R1C4 | R1C5 |
|R2C1 | R2C2 | R2C3 | R2C4 | R2C5 |
|R3C1 | R3C2 | R3C3 | R3C4 | R3C5 | 

With the current version I can highlight R1C1 in the first column and if I select to create multiple tickets I will get three tickets containing Summary "R1C1", "R2C1", and "R3C1" respectively.

What I suggested (just an initial thought on how to implement this), would be to:
1: Allow the user to add additional fields to the form. Imagine I add "Component", "FixVersion", and "Epic"
2: One _option_ could then be specify in the form field "Component" to contain "$h2", "FixVersion" to contain "$h3", and "Epic" to contain "$h5"
3: The macro could then be extended to recognise "$h2" as column header, and then add the corresponding cell value into this field per ticket.
4: I would then have tickets containing:
Ticket 1:
  - Summary: R1C1 
  - Component: R1C2
  - FixVersion: R1C3
  - Epic: R1C5

Ticket 2:
  - Summary: R2C1 
  - Component: R2C2
  - FixVersion: R2C3
  - Epic: R2C5

Ticket 3:
  - Summary: R3C1 
  - Component: R3C2
  - FixVersion: R3C3
  - Epic: R3C5

Hope that clarifies. The above example is obviously down to implementation, however the key is to achieve an outcome that allows me to create a more complete ticket based on content from a Confluence table.

A user with braces in the name is unable to create any spaces (example jevans[atlassian] or breaking[stuff]). It initially gives the 'wizard' option, but shortly afterwards gives a session invalidated error. 

Was reproduced on two different instances (5.4.1, 5.4.2) on separate computers, both running production installs on a local mac version. Both version were also running Jira if this matters.

The 'create space' button worked on accounts without braces. 

Both 'create', 'create space' and 'create a new space' links did not work (all go to the same popup)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Start up a fresh Confluence instance, with at least one user.
2. Select "Create space" from the "Spaces" menu in the top bar.
3. Fill in details, hit "Create".

Result:
Redirected to e.g. http://~~~:8090/confluence/display/MR , which results in a "Page Not Found".

Expected:
Redirect to e.g. http://~~~:8090/confluence/display/MR+Home , which is the new space's home.
fields.summary: "Create space" in Confluence 5.4.1 redirects to wrong URL after creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32393].
  {panel}

This would be an improvement to either "Space Attachments" or "Attachments" macro.  

you can configure "Attachments" macro to display attachments by label but only from pages you list - not from the whole space or from all of confluence.  So this does not allow enough flexibility for grout.  For example, if I wanted to on "customers" main page display all attachments labeled "Contract" I would have to specify all individual customer subpages in the macro settings.  If new customer if added later I need to go edit the macro to now also display results from the new customer sub page.  If I could specify either parent page, space, or all of confluence I would not have to go back and edit the macro settings.

In "space attachments" macro you can specify what space you want to display attachments from but you can by default filter them down to a specific label.  You can only show ALL attachments and the user must figure out what the label is we are trying to display files for by either sorting the list or filtering themselves.

So neither solution allows for displaying all files by label for all pages and subpages by specifying parent page, space or all of confluence.

We are on Confluence 5.4 at the moment.
fields.summary: space attachments by label

fields.description:
In a user macro using '$content.getAttachmentNamed', I would expect this to return the latest version of the named attachment. It seems to instead return the first version of the attachment.

{code}
## @param data:title=Data|type=string|required=true|desc=The name(plus extension) of an attachment on this page to use
#set( $attachment=$content.getAttachmentNamed( $paramdata ) )
#set( $version=$attachment.getAttachmentVersion())
$version
{code}

Reproduction Steps:
1. Create a new user macro with the code above
2. Use this macro on a page with a text file attachment
3. Update the attachment to version 2
4. Notice the original version will still be displayed

If this is actually the desired functionality then at least the documentation should be updated to state this as it is unclear at the moment.
fields.summary: $content.getAttachmentNamed returns the first version of a file

fields.description:
See [PLUGWEB-72|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGWEB-72] for additional context.

The [Atlassian Webresource 3.0 release notes|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Atlassian-plugins-webresource+3.0.0+released] recommend that when upgrading, the PageBuilderService is a new component that should be wired by the host application.

When Confluence upgraded to WR 3.0, this was not done, and instead Confluence uses a legacy, backwards-compatible constructor in the WebResourceManager that constructs a new instance of the PageBuilderService in-line.

This is problematic for plugin developers as some parts of the old WebResourceManager API are now only available through the new PageBuilderService API, and the PageBuilderService is currently inaccessible to plugins.

To address this, Confluence's should declare the PageBuilderService as a top-level, plugin-available Spring bean, and change Confluence's WebResourceManager to call the correct WebResourceManagerImpl constructor.
fields.summary: PageBuilderService is not available to plugins since upgrade to Atlassian Plugins Webresource 3.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32378].
  {panel}

On this New Feature request [CONF-8576|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-8576], there was a plan to have Confluence server able to receive emails, and depending on the email address, archive each email to the appropriate space. However, the decision was to not implement it as of yet.

However, there is a section in {{Confluence Admin console > Configuration > Mail Server}} which allows user to configure a POP Mail Server. As of now, this particular feature here is not entirely usable and might create a misunderstanding on user point of view.

In this case, please assess further the possibility to implement this or perhaps remove it temporarily from this part of Confluence Admin console.

Thank you and regards,
Lazuardi
fields.summary: Possibility of removing "Add a New POP Mail server" from Mail Servers configuration if it is not yet implemented in Confluence
